title.narrative: Improving Psychosocial Wellbeing of Children, Adolescent Girls and Young Mothers at risk of exploitation and abuse in families affected by food insecurity in Chitungwiza, Binga, Epworth and Rushinga

description.narrative: The main objective of this UNICEF project is to provide child protection services to droughted affected individuals in Zimbabwe. UNICEF will ensure that 10,000 children have access to community spaces through the establishment of 8 child friendly spaces and training of 500 facilitators. UNICEF will also provide 13,000 children and adolescents with information on sexual violence, child marriage and referrals for protection services. UNICEF will support 16 district level structures through the training on child protection rights including sexual and reproductive health rights. Some 15,000 individuals will be reached over 6 months.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS ZIMBABWE RAPID RESPONSE DROUGHT 2019

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Affected communities are mobilized to prevent and address violence, exploitation and abuse of children and women: existing systems to respond to the needs of GBV survivors are improved
